title: Unlocking VIP Access: How to Gain Status and Special Treatment in Trendy Venues (Ep 253)
caption: false

channel_info.title: Robbie Kramer
channel_info.description:
I'm Robbie Kramer 🎙Host of The Inner Confidence Podcast & Founder of Inner Confidence, Inc.

I lived an exhilarating single life filled with adventures and lessons, and ultimately achieved what I had always aspired to – finding an amazing, feminine, and loving wife. 

I believe my experiences provide a rare balance of wild freedom and committed love, equipping me with the insights to help you navigate the complexities of dating and relationships in today's world. Let me guide you to embrace your desires, improve your social prowess, and ultimately attract the partner who aligns with your highest aspirations.

You won’t find any fluffy, new-age, or cringy stuff here, just tested, proven and actionable advice that yields results.

Apply to join our exclusive Inner Confidence Community of ambitious men who are actively working together to achieve their goals faster   ► https://innerconfidence.com/community

You can email me at robbie@innerconfidence.com with any questions or comments.

transcription: {"text": "When I figured out which places were cool, I'd go there. I talked to the bartenders. I would tip the bouncers when they really weren't expecting. If I knew the place was cool, I'd show up before there was a line. So typically the line is going to start at like 930 in most cities. And so I'd probably show up at like 915 when there's like a minimal line and I'd shoot the shit and I'd talk with the bouncer and then I'd literally give him 20 bucks and be like, thanks, man. Hook me up next time you see me. And that's going to go such a long way because I'm going out of my way to like make that connection and I'm giving him money. And I'm gonna do the same thing with the bartenders. So next time I come back, I'm going to have status. I'm probably going to get straight in. I'm also going to ask him like what nights he works, what are the best nights to go, right? And then I'm literally giving him money. First of all, he's not talking to anyone because he's just like bored doing his job. And now I'm shooting the shit with him. I'm giving him something to do. I'm asking him questions which he's going to answer that are making him feel like he's in the know and he's someone of value. So I'm like hyping him up and I'm giving him money. So that is such an effective strategy. Obviously, if they're really busy, I'm not going to their brain and ask them all those questions when they're like trying to serve other people. So that's another reason to go earlier and you get a chance to connect with the people in these venues.
